intro: Celtis trinervia, commonly known as the three-veined hackberry, is a deciduous tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and heart-shaped leaves with three distinct veins. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by small, round fruits that are typically eaten by birds and small mammals. Celtis trinervia is often found in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and in woodland areas.
